intro: Fuirena hirta, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale yellow ray florets. Fuirena hirta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions.
